title: Textile, 1851–63
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller and possibly block printed on plain weave; highly glazed
description: Group having same ground, roller-printed, of a broad grey stripe formed of minute white dots alternating with white stripe edged with fancy foliage pattern. Different floral patterns printed over this ground, probably by block. A) Large Iris pattern, purple and green.B) Garden flowers. C) Sprays of blue flowers with grey-green foliage D) Small flower sprays, brown and green. E) Lillies of the Valley , pansies and roses in violet. F) Bright pink, all-over floral sprays. G) Same flower sprays as F in reds and browns. All highly glazed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1851–63.Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller and possibly block printed on plain weave; highly glazed. 1967-10-14-g.
